html.title: DHNB Sampo-UI Example
html.description: The Sampo-UI framework makes it possible to create highly customizable, user-friendly, and responsive user interfaces using current state-of-the-art JavaScript libraries and data from SPARQL endpoints.

appTitle.subheading: "Here to forge for us the Sampo, Hammer us the lid in colors"

appDescription1: Sampo is a web service for searching and studying place names. The search results can be viewed as a table, on maps, and as statistical distributions. Historical and current background maps are provided.
appDescription2: Start by choosing source dataset(s) and input a place name on the search field. Alternatively you can search by area.
selectPerspective: Select a perspective to search and browse the knowledge graph:
mainPageImageLicence: Images used under license from Shutterstock.com
backendErrorText: One of the backend services is not available at the moment. Please try again later.

infoHeader.toggleInstructions: Click to show or hide instructions

facetBar.sortByNumberOfSearchResults: Sort by number of search results

exportToYasgui: open the result table query in yasgui sparql editor
resultsAsCSV: download the search results as a CSV table

dateFacet.toBeforeFrom: The start date must be before the end date.

sliderFacet.invalidStartOrEnd: Min value must be smaller than max value. The smallest value can be {min} and the largest value can be {max}.

basemaps.topographicalMapNLS: Topographical map (National Land Survey of Finland)
basemaps.backgroundMapNLS: Background map (National Land Survey of Finland)
basemaps.airMapNLS: Aerial map (National Land Survey of Finland)

Register of Archaeological Sites, points (Finnish Heritage Agency)
externalLayers.WFS_MV_KulttuuriymparistoSuojellut:Muina: Register of Archaeological Sites, areas (Finnish Heritage Agency)

externalLayers.kotus:pitajat: Finnish parishes in 1938 (Institute for the Languages of Finland)
externalLayers.kotus:rajat-sms-alueet: Dialectical regions in Finland (Institute for the Languages of Finland)
externalLayers.kotus:rajat-sms-alueosat: Dialectical subregions in Finland (Institute for the Languages of Finland)
externalLayers.kotus:rajat-lansi-ita: Border between western and eastern dialects in Finland (Institute for the Languages of Finland)

leafletMap.wrongZoomLevel: The map zoom level has to at least 11
leafletMap.wrongZoomLevelFHA: The map zoom level has to be at least 13 in order to show this layer
leafletMap.tooManyResults: More than 500 results, please use clustered map or heatmap

instancePageGeneral.introduction:
This landing page provides a human-readable summary of the data points that link to this {entity}. The data included in this summary reflect only those data points used in the MMM Portal. Click the Open in Linked Data Browser on button on the Export tab to view the complete set of classes and properties linked to this record.

To cite this record, use its url. You can use also use the url to return directly to the record at any time.
instancePageGeneral.repetition:
Repetition of data

The same or similar data may appear within a single data field multiple times. This repetition occurs due to the merging of multiple records from different datasets to create the MMM record.

composition.label: Related to composition
composition.description: Compositions to which a person is somehow related to. The person can have perfromed in one of the performances of this composition, taken part in the performance in another way (e.g. as a director) or taken part in the creation of the composition itself as a composer or libretist.

sources:
Sources

Archive sources

  • Aleksanterin teatterin arkisto, Kansalliskirjasto
  • Mathias Weckströmin julistekokoelma, Kansalliskirjasto
  • Emelie ja Kaarlo Bergbomin arkisto, Suomalaisen Kirjallisuuden Seura, Kirjallisuusarkisto (SKS/KiA)
  • Svenska Teaternin arkisto (SLSA 1270), Svenska litteratursällskapet i Finland

Literature

  • Aspelin-Haapkylä, Eliel 1906–1909. Suomalaisen Teatterin historia, vol. I–IV. Helsinki: SKS. = EAH
  • Byckling, Liisa 2009. Keisarinajan kulisseissa: Helsingin venäläisen teatterin historia 1868–1918. Helsinki: SKS. = Byckling
  • Lüchou, Marianne 1977. Svenska teatern i Helsingfors: repertoar, styrelser och teaterchefer, konstnärlig personal 1860–1975. [Hfors]: Stiftelsen för Svenska teatern i Helsingfors/Söderström [distr.]. = Lüchou
  • Paavolainen, Pentti 2013. Nuori Bergbom: Kaarlo Bergbomin elämä ja työ I, 1843–1872. Teatterikorkeakoulun julkaisusarja 43. Helsinki: Taideyliopiston Teatterikorkeakoulu. 716 s. = Paavolainen I
  • Paavolainen, Pentti 2016. Arkadian arki: Kaarlo Bergbomin elämä ja työ II, 1872–1887. Teatterikorkeakoulun julkaisusarja 51. Helsinki: Taideyliopiston Teatterikorkeakoulu. 623 s. = Paavolainen II
  • Paavolainen, Pentti 2018. Kriisit ja kaipuu: Kaarlo Bergbomin elämä ja työ III, 1888–1906. Teatterikorkeakoulun julkaisusarja 64. Helsinki: Taideyliopiston Teatterikorkeakoulu. 732 s. = Paavolainen III
  • Sola, Wäinö 1951. Wäinö Sola kertoo. Porvoo: Söderström. 359 s. = Sola I
  • Hirn, Sven 1998. Alati kiertueella : teatterimme varhaisvaiheet vuoteen 1870. Helsinki: Yliopistopaino. = Hirn 1998

  • Finlands Allmänna Tidning
  • Helsingfors Dagblad
  • Helsingfors Tidningar
  • Helsingin Sanomat
  • Hufvudstadsbladet

  • Suometar

  • Åbo Tidningar
  • Åbo Underrättelser

Image license information

Landing page images

BANNER

Aleksanterin teatterin katsomo, 2019
Photographer: Tuomas Uusheimo.
Senaatti-kiinteistöt.

PERFORMANCES

Erkki Melartinin ooppera Aino Savonlinnan oopperajuhlilla Olavinlinnassa vuonna 1912. Keskellä näyttämöä pitkähiuksisena Ainona Aino Ackté. Kapellimestarina nuottitelineen luona oikealla selin yleisöön mustassa takissa ja olkihatussa säveltäjä Erkki Melartin.

Erkki Melartinin ooppera Aino Savonlinnan oopperajuhlilla Olavinlinnassa vuonna 1912, 1912
Photographer: Unknown.
Museovirasto, CC BY 4.0.
Identifier: HK19420903:42

PEOPLE

Emmy Achté, 1875
Photographer: Charles Riis.
Åbo Akademi, public domain.

ROLE CHARACTERS

Kohtaus Jules Massenet'n oopperasta Navarratar (La Navarraise], henkiklöt vasemmalta lukien: Aino Ackté, Wäinö Sola ja Eino Rautavaara. Kotimainen Ooppera, 1912.

Scenbild ur La Navaraise (Massenet), 1912
Photographer: Martikainen ja Kni.
Sibelius-museon arkisto, CC BY 4.0.
Identifier: SmF12

PERFORMANCE VENUES

Helsingin Ruotsalainen teatteri, 1890
